p: Similar to viral dissemination, viral transmission was only detected in mosquitoes that ingested ≥10 5.9 PFU/ml ( Table 4). Although transmission rates appeared to increase with increasing exposure doses, virtually all of this increase was accounted for by an increase in dissemination rates. The transmission rates ranged from 0–2% at a viremia level of 10 5.9, 3–15% at a viremia level of 10 6.9, and 13–19% at a viremia level of 10 7.5. Regardless of mosquito origin, infectious dose, or periods of extrinsic incubation, about 21% of the mosquitoes with a disseminated infection were able to transmit infectious virus to the capillary tube ( Table 4).
